content: tea light cakes © 2011 tricia l richardson an excellent way to celebrate any occasion without setting anything on fire these cute crocheted tea light covers work up very quickly and can be personalized in a million different ways perfect for a birthdays weddings baby showers or just to say congratulations these would make lovely table decorations for an outside event or a night light for a little one let your imagination go wild have your cake and light it up too instructions note at the end of each round the slip_stitch join chain 1 and first half_double_crochet of the next row are all done in the first half_double_crochet of the previous row round 1 chain 8 join to first chain to make a ring chain 1 16 half_double_crochet in ring join 16 round 2 chain 1 half_double_crochet 2 half_double_crochet in next st around join to blo of first half_double_crochet 24 round 3 chain 1 half_double_crochet in blo of each half_double_crochet join to both loops of first half_double_crochet round 4 5 chain 1 half_double_crochet in ea half_double_crochet around at end of round 5 cut yarn and weave in ends materials basic frosting sport weight yarn several yarns for the bottom of cake working in the flo of this round join main color and various scraps for a contrasting color with a slip_stitch in any half_double_crochet on round 5 decorations or embellishments *3 single_crochet in next st slip_stitch in next st* around end with 3 single_crochet g hook and slip_stitch to first slip_stitch cut yarn and weave in ends tapestry needle battery operated plastic tea light top edge of cake surface crochet below the unused loop of round 2 basic cake using only a few yards of yarn this cake should easily slip over a standard plastic tea light depending on your personal crochet technique you may need to adjust your hook size to get the right fit use your imagination to decorate cakes weave ribbon through round 4 embroider thread flowers sew on embellishments use buttons have fun celebrate revised june 25 2011 editing and clarity
